adverbs.description: vacuously (comparative more vacuously, superlative most vacuously)

entries.meaning: In a vacuous manner, lacking thought.
examples: Here, in distress that was consternation, and in fear that was panic, excitedly bobbed up and down a cowboy in bearskin chaps, vacuously repeating the exclamation, "Oh God! Oh God!"  […]

entries.meaning: (logic) Because of being a vacuous truth.
examples: The statement is vacuously true because P is false and P implies Q.
